answers.q: how do i get my john deere e130 engaged to move forward
answers.a: This seems to refer to a lawn tractor, but E130 is Indanthrene blue RS (indanthrone blue), a synthetic blue vat dye/pigment (PB60) not related to machinery and not approved as a food color in the EU or US.

answers.q: how many gallons of gas does john deee e130 take
answers.a: E130 is a dye, not a fuel tank; as a food additive it has no permitted use level because it is not authorized in the EU or US.

answers.q: how to change oil filter on john deere e130
answers.a: E130 here refers to a synthetic anthraquinone blue pigment (Indanthrene blue RS), unrelated to engine maintenance, and it is not approved for food use in the EU or US.

answers.q: how to change the john deere e130 blades without dropping the mower deck
answers.a: E130 is a blue vat dye (indanthrone blue) valued for excellent lightfastness in paints and textiles, but as a food additive it is assigned E130 and is not authorized in the EU or US.

answers.q: how to install a bumper on a john deere e130
answers.a: This appears to be about a lawn tractor, but E130 is Indanthrene blue RS, a synthetic pigment used in coatings and textile dyeing with no approved food uses in the EU or US.
